page.title: 05LANDRAKE METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: Like many village churches today, weekly attendances are low,with elderly congregations.Landrake has a Sunday School of over thirty children. Plans are in hand for altering the internal structure of the chapel making it smaller and warmer with kitchen and toilet facilities so that the building can be used more during the week. Landrake Chapel is in the Saltash Circuit of thirteen churches with two ministers.Once a month a minister takes the service,relying on local preachers for other Sundays.There is only one service on the Sunday except for Harvest and Anniversary times. Coffee mornings,bring & buy and a pantomine help to bring in money for general funds.A summer coach trip for a day at the seaside is organised,with the Sunday School children going free.
